timeline.author: vkryachko

replies.bodyText: Brilliant, I didn't notice this was a builder!
replies.author: JasonAHeron

timeline.author: vkryachko

timeline.bodyText: Why are you using continueWithTask? do you want to proceed even if this task is cancelled?
timeline.author: vkryachko

replies.bodyText: so now I changed it to continueWith and I check both results against null. Am I not handling error cases correctly?
replies.author: JasonAHeron

replies.bodyText: I am actually not sure that null can be returned at all from those tasks, if an error happened getResult() will throw that error so I think it should be fine in terms of error handling.
replies.author: vkryachko

timeline.bodyText: It looks like this method can happen in parallel with the above getId() any reason you are doing them sequentially?, i.e.  could you try doing Tasks.whenAll(idTask, tokenTask).continueWith()?
timeline.author: vkryachko

timeline.bodyText: Is this no longer desirable? Or did FIS change in a way that makes it a non-issue?
timeline.author: vkryachko

replies.bodyText: This just felt like a premature optimization and it seemed like this would be a good time to understand if it was actually necessary
replies.author: JasonAHeron

timeline.author: vkryachko
vkryachko
vkryachko

timeline.bodyText:
None of the tasks will return null. Its on me for not adding the annotations on the APIs. I will update that on my end.
The Tasks would throw exceptions which you might want to handle based on completion state.
timeline.author: ankitaj224

timeline.bodyText: nit: call it fid or instanceId to differentiate from any other type of id used in FIAM. Idk if there is one, just think it would avoid any confusion.
timeline.author: ankitaj224

timeline.bodyText: Wondering if you should depend on the released version vs the HEAD? Idk whats the standard way in firebase.
timeline.author: ankitaj224
